Name: An Interview with the Avuncular Broker
Description:
He meets you on the balcony of a shoreside coffee-house. His handshake is effusive. His smile and cummerbund are broad. He urges you to squares of sticky baklava, and a tiny glass of black coffee sweetened with a sprig of mint.

"I trust you won't mind answering a few questions?" He asks, opening a notebook. "To ensure we're on the same page, so to speak." The interview is scandalously personal. What business has he to ask such things?

DefaultEvent.Name: An unexpected tactic
DefaultEvent.Description: He blinks in surprise. "Goodness. I must admit, I expected you to lie. Never mind, never mind. Knowing you as well as I do now," he studies his notebook, too embarrassed to meet your eye, "I think we can do business." [You may accept the Broker's Commission in Adam's Way.]

ChildBranches.Name: Answer truthfully
ChildBranches.Description: Though it means giving up a secret.

DefaultEvent.Name: Disappointing news
DefaultEvent.Description: "A pleasure to meet you. I'm sure we'll be in touch." That doesn't sound promising.

ChildBranches.Name: Lie to him
ChildBranches.Description: There are things he doesn't need to know.
